Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hylin a1 (hylin-a1; Hylin a-1; UCLL1c; Leu-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: C-terminal amidation.Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 64 uM), E. coli (MIC 32 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 8 uM), and E. faecalis (MIC 16 uM).Virus: Also inhibit bovine and caprine herpesviruses, canine distemper virus, bovine viral diarrhea virus, and Schmallenberg virus (Chianese et al., 2023). Block early stage infection of herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1) and type 2 (HSV-2), (MOA:virus) probabbly by damaging viral envelops (Chianese et al., 2024).SAR: Addition of an acidic residue to the N-terminus disrupted its activity against Gram- bacteria.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure bound to SDS micellesherein the PDB. Structures and molecular dynamics of analogs have also been studied (Crusca E et al., 2017).Updated 4/2014; 4/2016; 4/2017; 6/2019; 7/2021; 9/2023; 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Castro MS, Ferreira TC, Cilli EM, Crusca E, Mendes-Giannini MJ, Sebben A, Ricart CA, Sousa MV, Fontes W.2009
Literature Information.Title: Hylin a1, the first cytolytic peptide isolated from the arboreal South American frog Hypsiboas albopunctatus ("spotted treefrog").
